title.narrative: TRANSFORMING RESIDENTIAL INSTITUTIONS

description.narrative: Output 2.3: National authorities endorse and resource the transformation of residential institutions, including schools for children with offending behaviour., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2: Children, especially those in difficult life circumstances, suffer, witness and practice less psychological and physical maltreatment, including all forms of harm, abuse, neglect, and exploitation at home, in school, in care, in custody and in public spaces.

sector.narrative: Alternative care reform and service provision
Child protection focused on care and support for children with disabilities
Protective services for children on the move
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.3: National authorities endorse and resource the transformation of residential institutions, including schools forchildren with offending behaviour.

description.narrative: The National Child Rights Protection Committee has reported about the establishment of 16 child support centers to replace residential institutions, in particular orphanages for 4-17. UNICEF supported the testing of cross-sectoral standard operating procedures for alternative service delivery and analyses data gaps in childcare. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:18/01/2021

title.narrative: Readiness of residential schools for children with offending behaviour and centres of adaptation of adolescents to transform into non-institutional specialised social services, small-scale in-care rehabilitation services and community-based gatekeeping services(41869)

baseline.value: Residential schools for children with offending behaviour and and centres of adaptation of adolescents services are not ready to transform* into non-institutional specialised social services, small-sc

target.value: 2020:By end 2020, standards for non-institutional specialised social services and small-scale in-care rehabilitation services are developed to replace schools for children with offending behaviour

actual.value: 2020:By end 2020, standards for non-institutional specialized social services and small-scale in-care rehabilitation services are developed and submitted to the Child Rights Protection committee for consideration of reforming schools for children with offendin

title.narrative: Availability of a) oblast action plans to transform residential institutions into centres for specialised social services, including the reallocation of resources to alternatives; and b) transformation plans of individual residential institutions for children out of parental care; and extent of implementation(57921)

baseline.value: a) 0 of 16; no implementation (2015) b) 0 of 188; no implementation (2014)

target.value: 2020:3 of 16 oblasts have action plans; at least 50% implementation respectively

actual.value: 2020:2 out of 138 state-run residential institutions have a transformation plan; no information on the status of their implementation is available.
